intro: Euphrasia adenocaulon, commonly known as the woolly eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine, soft hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Euphrasia adenocaulon is part of the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar morphological features.
